thread.title: College football injuries: Is this the worst year ever?
thread.title_full: College football injuries: Is this the worst year ever?

author: wbender@sportingnews.com (Bill Bender)
title: College football injuries: Is this the worst year ever?
text:
College football injuries: Is this the worst year ever? Sporting News 1 day ago wbender@sportingnews.com (Bill Bender)
© Provided by Sporting News Is this the worst year ever for college football injuries?
AdChoices It's difficult to say for sure, but there’s no doubt the rash of season-ending and potential season-ending injuries continues to strike each week. The 2015 season has seen too many impact players go down. It’s sure to have an effect on the race for the College Football Playoff. A few Heisman Trophy contenders were injured, too.
MORE: SN Week 5 Top 20 | Which unbeaten teams survive October?
It started in fall camp and has continued through September. Which star players suffered major injuries? Here’s a closer look.
1 Kendall Fuller, CB, Virginia Tech
© Provided by Sporting News Sept. 29: The Hokies announced Fuller, a standout cornerback, will miss the rest of the 2015 season after undergoing knee surgery.
MORE: Who are the frontrunners for ACC top player?
2 Jon Hilliman, RB, Boston College
© Provided by Sporting News Sept. 29: Boston College announces the loss of leading rusher Jon Hilliman one week after losing starting quarterback Darius Wade to a season-ending ankle injury.
3 Scooby Wright, LB, Arizona
© Provided by Sporting News Sept. 26: Wright suffered a torn meniscus in Week 1, returned against UCLA and suffered a right foot sprain and will miss several weeks. He led the nation with 164 tackles in 2014. Wright hasn't been ruled out for the season yet.
MORE: Week 5 SN Pac-12 Power Rankings
4 Myles Jack, LB, UCLA
© Provided by Sporting News Sept. 23: UCLA announces two-way standout Myles Jack will miss the rest of the season with a torn meniscus suffered in practice.
MORE: 10 best Pac-12 MVP candidates
5 Fabian Moreau, CB, UCLA
© Provided by Sporting News Sept. 22: The Bruins lose Moreau, a starting cornerback, for the remainder of the season to a Lisfranc injury.
6 Drue Tranquill, S, Notre Dame
© Provided by Sporting News Sept. 20: Notre Dame announces safety Drue Tranquill has been ruled out for the remainder of the season with a torn ACL in his right knee, which he suffered after celebrating a pass breakup against Georgia Tech.
7 Robert Foster, WR, Alabama
© Provided by Sporting News Sept. 19: Foster suffered a torn rotator cuff in the loss to Ole Miss. He had 10 catches for 116 yards and two TDs through Alabama’s first three games.
MORE: 10 top candidates for SEC MVP
8 Ranthony Texada, CB, TCU
© Provided by Sporting News Sept. 19: The Horned Frogs lost Texada to a right knee injury against SMU. Texada, a starting cornerback, joined linebacker Sammy Douglas, who was the lost in the season opener with an undisclosed injury.
FIRST-AND-10: Baylor begins battle vs. perception
9 Malik Zaire, QB, Notre Dame
© Provided by Sporting News Sept. 12: Notre Dame quarterback Malik Zaire suffers a season-ending fractured ankle against Virginia. Backup quarterback DeShone Kizer leads the Irish to a last-minute win against the Cavaliers.
REPORT CARD: How are the new starting quarterbacks faring?
10 James Conner, RB, Pittsburgh
© Provided by Sporting News Sept. 7: Pitt announces running back James Conner will miss the season with a torn MCL. Conner had 1,765 rushing yards and 26 TDs in 2014 and had 77 yards and two TDs in the opener against Youngstown State before suffering the injury.
11 Eddie Vanderdoes, DT, UCLA
© Provided by Sporting News Sept. 5: Vanderdoes suffers a torn ACL in the season-opening win against Virginia. Vanderdoes finishes the game but announces two days later he will miss the rest of the season.
12 Jesse Ertz, QB, Kansas State
© Provided by Sporting News Sept. 5: Ertz suffers a knee injury just two plays into the season-opener against South Dakota and likely will miss the rest of the season.
MORE: Ranking the 10 best Big 12 MVP candidates
13 Tarean Folston, RB, Notre Dame
© Provided by Sporting News Sept. 5: Folston suffers torn MCL in the season-opening win against Texas after three carries for 19 yards. Notre Dame lost its starting running back for the season as a result.
14 Taysom Hill, QB, BYU
© Provided by Sporting News Sept. 5: Hill suffered a season-ending Lisfranc injury in his right foot in the dramatic win against Nebraska. Tanner Mangum replaced Hill and threw the game-winning Hail Mary against the Cornhuskers.
15 Carl Lawson, DE, Auburn
© Provided by Sporting News Sept. 5: Auburn loses sophomore defensive end Carl Lawson to a hip injury. Lawson hasn't been ruled out for the season yet, but he's expected to miss an extended period of time after missing all of 2014 with a knee injury.
MORE: September winners & losers
16 Mike Williams, WR, Clemson
© Provided by Sporting News Sept. 5: Williams suffers a small neck fracture when his head hits the goal post in a season-opening win against Wofford. Clemson coach Dabo Swinney says Williams is out indefinitely.
MORE: This week's ACC Power Rankings
17 Noah Brown, WR, Ohio State
© Provided by Sporting News Aug. 26: Brown, a breakout candidate at receiver for the Buckeyes, suffered a broken leg in practice . He's out for the 2015 season.
MORE: Top 10 Ohio State Buckeyes
18 Jonathan Williams, RB, Arkansas
© Provided by Sporting News Aug. 16: Williams suffered a season-ending left foot injury during a fall camp scrimmage. He led the Razorbacks in 2014 with 1,190 rushing yards and 5.6 yards per carry.
MORE: Week 5 SN SEC Power Rankings
19 Ed Davis, LB, Michigan State
© Provided by Sporting News Aug. 12: Davis suffered a season-ending knee injury in fall camp. He had seven sacks as a junior in 2014 and was an All-American candidate heading into his senior season.
MORE: 10 top Big Ten MVP candidates
20 Thomas Tyner, RB, Oregon
© Provided by Sporting News Aug. 9: Oregon announced Tyner, who rushed for 573 yards and five TDs a sophomore, would miss the season after shoulder surgery .
Go to MSN Home
